p: The results of demographic information of the households presented in Table 1 show that majority of the respondents were within the age range of ≤ 35–69. Thulamela had the smallest proportion of population within the age limit of ≥ 70. Furthermore, women were the majority in all the municipalities (71.6% – 83.3%), largely because men migrate to urban areas for work and send remittances to their families in the rural area. Majority of the respondents in Makhado (64.6%) and Mutale (73.4%), and fewer respondents in Thulamela (45.5%) did not have formal education. Length of residency of most respondent was in the range of 1–5 years (Makhado), 11–15 years (Mutale) and 20 years and above (Thulamela).
